clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Pathogen-colonization in Cystic Fibrosis Airways and Ability to Smell
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Chronic Rhinosinusitis, Pathogen-colonization in the Upper and Lower Airways and Ability to Smell in Cystic Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to detect the prevalence of chronic rhinosinusitis, pathogen colonization of the lower and upper airways and, in a sub-cohort the sense of smelling in patients with cystic fibrosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The sub-study on the sense of smelling in CF has been finalized in the meantime. Results were published in 2012:
Smell in cystic fibrosis. Lindig J, Steger C, Beiersdorf N, Michl R, Beck JF, Hummel T, Mainz JG. Eur Arch Otorhinolaryngol. 2013 Mar;270(3):915-21. doi: 10.1007/s00405-012-2124-2. Epub 2012 Aug 14.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamics in CF upper and lower airway colonization with pathogens
primary_outcome.description: longitudinal non-invasive sampling of upper and lower airways in CF

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of ability to smell in CF patients

arm_group.arm_group_label: CF patients of all age groups
arm_group.description: Longitudinal prospective assessment of upper and lower airway colonization in all patients attended in the Jena University CF centre

intervention.description: non-invasive longitudinal assessment of pathogen colonization in both airway levels
intervention.arm_group_label: CF patients of all age groups

study_pop.textblock: patients of the CF outpatients clinic and hospitalized CF patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a confirmed diagnosis of cystic fibrosis
